excerpt: Elaborately adorned 14th-century tower (56 meters at its tallest point) with a world-famous lean.
detail_description: The Tower of Pisa, also known as Torre Pendente di Pisa, is a stunning 14th-century structure in Italy that has gained worldwide fame for its distinctive lean. The tower originally leaned at a dramatic angle of 5.5 degrees but extensive restoration work has reduced the lean to less than 4.0 degrees.
name: Tower of Pisa
address: Piazza del Duomo, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Small church built in the 1200s featuring an ornate gothic facade, many statues & a painted ceiling.
detail_description: Chiesa di Santa Maria della Spina is a small Gothic church in Pisa, situated on the southern bank of the river Arno. It was constructed in the 1200s by the Gualandi family and originally named Santa Maria di Pontenovo. The church's title "della Spina" refers to a thorn from Christ's crown of thorns, which was housed there until the 19th century.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria della Spina
address: Lungarno Gambacorti, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Elegant cemetery for famous Pisans set around a cloistered quadrangle with restored 1300s frescoes.
detail_description: Camposanto Monumentale, also known as the Monumental Cemetery of Pisa, is a stunning site located in Miracle Square. This elegant cemetery was built to house the graves of noble and illustrious citizens and features a rectangular gallery adorned with Roman sarcophagi and beautiful frescoes by renowned artists such as Taddeo Gaddi, Spinello Aretino, and Benozzo Gozzoli.
name: Camposanto
address: Piazza del Duomo, 17, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Walled area with iconic leaning bell tower & white marble buildings including a medieval cathedral.
detail_description: Piazza dei Miracoli is a walled area in Pisa, featuring the iconic leaning bell tower and stunning white marble buildings, including a medieval cathedral. The Ristorante La Scaletta, owned by Chef Dino Ricci, has been a culinary landmark since the mid-1800s and is conveniently located just steps away from the famous tower.
name: Piazza dei Miracoli
address: Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Warren-like city neighborhood featuring narrow alleys & streets lined with shops & restaurants.
detail_description: Borgo Stretto is a bustling neighborhood in Pisa, known for its narrow alleys and streets lined with shops and restaurants. The area features elegant palaces dating back to the 14th and 15th centuries, as well as numerous bars and cafes with outdoor seating. At the heart of Borgo Stretto is Piazza delle Vettovaglie, where a historic market takes place.
name: Borgo Stretto
address: Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: A permanent collection of Italian art, plus temporary exhibitions, in a restored medieval building.
detail_description: Palazzo Blu is a captivating art museum housed in a beautifully restored medieval building located along the Arno River in Lungarni di Pisa. The museum boasts a remarkable permanent collection of Italian art, featuring exquisite paintings and artworks from the 5th to the 15th century. Visitors can also immerse themselves in splendid contemporary art pieces and temporary exhibitions.
name: Palazzo Blu
address: Lungarno Gambacorti, 9, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Piazza dei Cavalieri in Pisa is a charming and historically significant square that offers a glimpse into the city's business and academic life. Recently renovated, the area now features a delightful pedestrian pathway connecting the cathedral to the station. This route leads through the medieval political center of Pisa, where one can find Palazzo della Carovana, adorned by Giorgio Vasari and currently serving as the prestigious Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa, Italy's leading university.
name: Piazza dei Cavalieri
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Pisa is a city in Italy's Tuscany region best known for its iconic Leaning Tower. Already tilting when it was completed in 1372, the 56m white-marble cylinder is the bell tower of the Romanesque, striped-marble cathedral that rises next to it in the Piazza dei Miracoli. Also in the piazza is the Baptistry, whose renowned acoustics are demonstrated by amateur singers daily, and the Caposanto Monumentale cemetery.
detail_description: Pisa, located in Italy's Tuscany region, is famous for its iconic Leaning Tower and the Romanesque cathedral next to it in the Piazza dei Miracoli. The Baptistry and Caposanto Monumentale cemetery are also found in this square. Additionally, Monte Pisano is known for its rich groundwater that feeds historic aqueducts and fountains of Pisa and Lucca.
name: Pisa
address: Province of Pisa, Italy

excerpt: Collected treasures of the cathedral & baptistery, including paintings & archaeological finds.
detail_description: Nestled within the enchanting Pisa Cathedral Complex, the Museo dell'Opera del Duomo is a treasure trove of art and history that every traveler should explore. This captivating museum showcases an impressive array of artifacts from the cathedral and baptistery, including exquisite sculptures, stunning frescoes, and intricate stained glass windows. Spanning two floors, visitors can wander through various rooms filled with religious artworks that tell the story of Pisa's iconic landmarks.
name: Museo dell'Opera del Duomo
address: Piazza del Duomo, 23, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Renaissance square with a statue of Cosimo I de Medici, the first Grand Duke of Tuscany.
detail_description: Piazza dei Cavalieri, also known as Knights' Square, is a Renaissance square in Pisa, Italy. It features a statue of Cosimo I de Medici, the first Grand Duke of Tuscany. The square is surrounded by notable landmarks such as the Medici Palace (Palazzo Vecchio), the Church of San Matteo and National Museum.
name: Piazza dei Cavalieri
address: P.za dei Cavalieri, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Tuttomondo, a vibrant masterpiece by the renowned American street artist Keith Haring, is a must-see gem nestled in Pisa. Just a stone's throw from the bustling Corso Italia and near the train station, this stunning mural spans an impressive 180 square meters on the wall of the Church of Sant Antonio Abate. Created in just four days back in 1989, it stands as Haring's final work before his untimely passing.
name: Tuttomondo (Keith Haring)
address: P.za V. Emanuele II, 18, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Grand marble-striped cathedral known for its ornate Romanesque bronze doors & carved 1300s pulpit.
detail_description: Cattedrale di Pisa, also known as the Cathedral of Pisa or Santa Maria Assunta, is a grand marble-striped cathedral famous for its ornate Romanesque bronze doors and a carved 1300s pulpit. Initially built as the freestanding bell tower for the nearby Duomo di Pisa, it began to lean due to unstable soil during construction in the 12th century.
name: Cattedrale di Pisa
address: Piazza del Duomo, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Museum housing collections of medieval religious art, ceramics & illuminated manuscripts.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Pisa, the National Museum of San Matteo is a treasure trove for art enthusiasts and history buffs alike. This remarkable museum showcases an extensive collection of medieval religious art, ceramics, and illuminated manuscripts that transport visitors back to the Middle Ages.
name: National Museum of San Matteo
address: Piazza San Matteo In Soarta, 1, 56127 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Late 16th-century palace & university with an ornate façade, housing fine art & sculptures.
detail_description: Palazzo della Carovana is a stunning 16th-century palace located in Pisa, Italy. It features an ornate façade adorned with allegorical figures and zodiac signs. The palace houses fine art, sculptures, and the prestigious Scuola Normale Superiore. Additionally, it is home to the Museum of the Sinopie, displaying preparatory drawings for frescoes in the Camposanto.
name: Palazzo della Carovana
address: Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa - Classe di Scienze Matematiche Fisiche e Naturali, P.za dei Cavalieri, 7, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Botanical gardens founded in 16th century with arboretum, medicinal plants, fountains & flowerbeds.
detail_description: The Botanical Garden and Museum in Pisa is a serene oasis founded in the 16th century, featuring an arboretum, medicinal plants, fountains, and flowerbeds. It's a perfect spot for families with kids to explore different greenhouses and areas while enjoying the lush surroundings. The museum on the grounds offers an interesting insight into botanical history.
name: Orto e Museo Botanico
address: Via Luca Ghini, 13, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Piazza delle Vettovaglie is a charming square in Pisa that dates back to the 16th century, showcasing the city's historical and architectural significance. The square features a beautiful double-arched loggia reminiscent of convent cloisters from the 15th century. It is also home to Mercato delle Vettovaglie, Pisa's main produce market where locals gather to stock up on fresh ingredients and immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere.
name: Piazza delle Vettovaglie
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Arched bridge covered in white Verona stone, with sunset & nighttime views of illuminated buildings.
detail_description: Ponte di Mezzo is a picturesque arched bridge made of white Verona stone in Pisa, Italy. It spans 89 meters and connects the old center of Pisa to the new part, offering stunning sunset and nighttime views of illuminated buildings along the Arno River. The bridge is a favorite spot for locals and visitors to take in the calming riverbank scenery with colorful Italian homes on both sides.
name: Ponte di Mezzo
address: 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Large medieval baptistery praised for its acoustics, with panels by renowned sculptor Pisano.
detail_description: Located in the Square of Miracles, Battistero di San Giovanni is a stunning medieval baptistery that often goes unnoticed next to its towering neighbors. This round building boasts an impressive interior with a baptism font at its center and offers a unique vantage point from its top floor overlooking the cathedral. Constructed in the 12th century in Romanesque style, it features Gothic and Renaissance influences as well.
name: Battistero di San Giovanni
address: Piazza del Duomo, 23, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Gelateria De' Coltelli, located in Pisa, is a popular spot among locals for its delicious gelato. The De Coltelli family has a long history in ice cream making, dating back to the 17th century. They take pride in using fresh seasonal fruits and natural ingredients sourced from the surrounding region to create their hand-crafted gelato. All their flavors and cones are gluten-free, making it a safe option for those with celiac disease.
name: Gelateria De' Coltelli
address: Lungarno Antonio Pacinotti, 23, 56100 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Grassy expanse that's home to the landmark leaning tower and grand marble-striped Pisa Cathedral.
detail_description: Piazza del Duomo, also known as Piazza dei Miracoli or Square of Miracles, is a renowned 8.87-hectare area in Pisa, Tuscany. This walled square is a significant center of medieval art and boasts some of the finest architectural complexes globally.
name: Piazza del Duomo
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: 1300s building housing restored frescos & their preparatory outlines, relocated from a cemetery.
detail_description: The Sinopie Museum, located in a 1300s building, offers a unique glimpse into the creation of the famous frescoes from the Camposanto Cemetery. It houses restored frescos and their preparatory outlines, showcasing original sketches used in their designs. The museum provides an intriguing behind-the-scenes look at the 14th-century frescoes by displaying the rough initial drawings created with a dark reddish-brown pigment known as sinopia during the Renaissance.
name: Sinopie Museum
address: Piazza del Duomo, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: The Baths of Nero, also known as Bagni di Nerone, are an ancient archaeological site dating back to the 1st century AD. Although much of the original complex has been lost, visitors can still admire remnants of marble and mosaics. The baths were connected to the Caldaccoli aqueduct which supplied water to the complex. Once a bustling social and recreational center in ancient Pisa, these Roman baths offer a fascinating glimpse into history.
name: Baths of Nero
address: Largo Parlascio, 14, 56123 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Teatro Verdi is a historic theater in Pisa that has been an integral part of the city's cultural scene since 1867. The opulent architecture and lavish interior decorations make it a sight to behold, offering visitors a glimpse into the lives of Tuscan nobility. The theater hosts a variety of performances including opera, concerts, and plays, captivating audiences with its stunning ambiance and impressive acoustics.
name: Teatro Verdi
address: Via Palestro, 40, 56127 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: The Mura di Pisa, the ancient city walls of Pisa, are a remarkable testament to the city's medieval past. These historic fortifications not only offer a glimpse into Italy's architectural heritage but also provide stunning panoramic views of the iconic Leaning Tower and surrounding areas. Visitors can access four different points along the wall, which may involve some steps, making it an adventurous stop during your exploration of Piazza dei Miracoli.
name: Mura di Pisa
address: Piazza dei Miracoli, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Open since 1591, a university garden conserving international plant species & a botany museum.
detail_description: Orto e Museo Botanico is a historical botanical garden in Pisa, open since 1591. The garden is divided into three parts and features a diverse collection of international plant species, including trees, water plants, and greenhouses with local herbs. Visitors can also explore the two-floor botany museum inside the garden.
name: Orto e Museo Botanico
address: Via Roma, 56, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: The Museo Nazionale di Palazzo Reale, located in Pisa, was once the city residence of powerful families like the Medici and Habsburg-Lorraine. This 16th-century palace now houses a vast collection of medieval and modern secular and religious works, including pieces by renowned artists such as Raphael and Rosso Fiorentino.
name: Museo Nazionale di Palazzo Reale
address: Lungarno Antonio Pacinotti, 46, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Originally built from 1440 & reconstructed after taking damage, this fortress now houses a garden.
detail_description: Giardino Scotto, also known as Cittadella Nuova, is a peaceful garden nestled within an ancient fortress in Pisa. Originally built in 1440 and reconstructed after sustaining damage, this fortress now houses the beautiful Giardino Scotto. The park features large grassy areas, an open-air theater, and a playground, making it a great place for picnics or leisurely strolls. During the summer, the garden hosts outdoor cinema screenings and music festivals.
name: Giardino Scotto
address: Lungarno Leonardo Fibonacci, 2, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: This Catholic church from the early 11th century features Romanesque design & notable murals.
detail_description: San Paolo a Ripa d'Arno is an impressive Romanesque church dating back to the 11th century, located in Piazza San Paolo on the banks of the Arno River. It was originally built in 805 for Vallombrosan monks and has undergone several reconstructions over time.
name: Chiesa Parrocchiale di San Paolo
address: Piazza S. Paolo a Ripa D'Arno, 9, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Lively pedestrian shopping street with Italian & global boutiques selling clothing & cosmetics.
detail_description: Corso Italia is a vibrant pedestrian shopping street lined with a mix of Italian and international boutiques offering fashion, cosmetics, and more. It's the perfect place to escape the touristy shops near the Leaning Tower and explore the bustling Borgo Stretto and Corso Italia, which are Pisa's primary shopping destinations.
name: Corso Italia
address: 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Lungarni di Pisa is a charming promenade along the Arno River, featuring historic buildings and landmarks such as Museo delle Navi Antiche di Pisa and the National Museum of the Royal Palace. The area is also dotted with shops, restaurants, and cafes, offering a lively atmosphere for visitors to enjoy. This picturesque riverside location provides a glimpse into Pisa's past through its medieval architecture and colorful tower houses.
name: Lungarni di Pisa
address: Ponte Solferino, 56125 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: The Square of Miracles Apartment is located in the Piazza dei Miracoli, also known as the Square of Miracles or Cathedral Square, in Pisa, Tuscany. This walled 8.87-hectare area is a significant center of medieval art and home to four impressive religious buildings: the Pisa Cathedral, the Pisa Baptistry, the Campanile, and the Camposanto Monumentale.
name: The Square of Miracles Apartment
address: Via Cammeo Carlo Salomone, 33, 56122 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: The Fontana dei Putti, also known as the Fountain with Angels, is a charming marble fountain located in Piazza dei Miracoli in Pisa. Dating back to the 17th century, this beautiful monument served as a vital water source for the locals. Sculpted by Giovanni Antonio Cybei, it features statues of children and adds to the picturesque setting near the Leaning Tower of Pisa and the Cathedral of Pisa.
name: Fontana dei Putti
address: Piazza Arcivescovado, 3, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa, originally a political and civil center in the middle ages, is now a prestigious university specializing in scientific literature and politics. It accepts only a select few students each year. The university is located in the Piazza dei Cavalieri, alongside other notable landmarks such as Torre Della, the church of Santo Stefano dei Cavalieri, and Palazzo della Carovana. The institution was established by Napoleon and is renowned for its academic excellence.
name: Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa
address: P.za dei Cavalieri, 7, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Rinascimento Bed & Breakfast offers a unique stay in the heart of medieval Pisa, with rooms featuring elaborate frescoed ceilings and stately four-poster beds. The B&B is located near local trade, cafes, and restaurants, providing an authentic experience of the city. Situated in an authentic medieval building, the B&B's design evokes a romantic vibe with its painted ceilings and long curtains.
name: Rinascimento Bed & Breakfast
address: Battista, Piazza Gian, Piazza Giovan Battista Donati, n.13, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Charming rooms, a chic lounge & a private garden in a polished B&B set in a historic building.
detail_description: B&B di Camilla is a stylish and luxurious bed and breakfast located in a historic building in Pisa. The charming rooms, chic lounge, and private garden make it an ideal choice for couples seeking a romantic getaway. The interior exudes elegance with its white and cream color scheme, soft lighting, and quirky features like old fireplaces and vaulted doorways. Guests can enjoy the serene garden views while staying connected with free WiFi.
name: B&B di Camilla
address: Via San Francesco, 45, 56127 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Torre Guelfa, a 15th-century tower located in Pisa, Italy, offers visitors a glimpse into the city's rich history. Originally built to control the river route into the city, it now provides stunning views of the coast and San Rossore natural park from its top. The tower also houses coats of arms of prominent Pisan families and is part of a redevelopment project that includes an arts and events space.
name: Torre Guelfa
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Arena Garibaldi – Stadio Romeo Anconetani is the beloved home stadium of Pisa SC, a prominent football team in the city currently competing in Italy's Series B. This historic venue has also hosted national matches and boasts a rich history, including the discovery of an Etruscan necropolis during excavations in 1991. While it may not have the most modern facilities, its character and passionate fan base create an incredible atmosphere for visitors and locals alike.
name: Arena Garibaldi – Stadio Romeo Anconetani
address: Via Antonio Rosmini, 61, 56123 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Piazza del Duomo, also known as the Piazza dei Miracoli, is home to the candy-striped Duomo which served as a model for Tuscan Romanesque cathedrals. The cathedral features contrasting bands of color, blind arcading, colonnaded gallery and inlaid marble creating a stunning visual effect. This square showcases the Pisan style's ability to select dramatic spaces with its main buildings forming a cohesive ensemble.
name: Piazza del Duomo
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: Located near the Leaning Tower of Pisa, Museo Aviotruppe Esercito Italiano is a small but impressive museum that military history enthusiasts will love. Established in 1971, it houses over 3,000 artifacts including weapons, uniforms, vehicles from various conflicts and interesting historical information. The collection covers Italian aviation troops' history from World War I to the present day.
name: Museo Aviotruppe Esercito Italiano
address: Caserma Gamerra, Via di Gello, 138, 56123 Pisa PI, Italy

name: Piazza Cairoli
address: Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Romanesque Catholic church on an ancient site, with portraits of popes up to the 15th century.
detail_description: San Piero a Grado is a Romanesque Catholic church located on the road to Pisa's marina, away from the city center. It was built on the ancient port of Pisa where St. Peter is believed to have landed in Italy in 44 AD. The church has undergone construction and modifications over two centuries and features vibrant frescoes lining its interior. According to legend, it stands at the site where St.
name: San Piero a Grado
address: Via Vecchia di Marina, 5, 56010 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Gothic-style 13th-century Catholic church featuring a pulpit from which St. Thomas Aquinas preached.
detail_description: Chiesa di Santa Caterina d'Alessandria is a 13th-century Gothic-style Catholic church located south of the Arno River. It underwent renovations in the 19th century, resulting in a nave with a gabled roof and plastered walls, except for the lower part of the X and XI century apse. The church is famous for housing the pulpit from which St. Thomas Aquinas preached.
name: Chiesa di Santa Caterina d'Alessandria
address: Piazza Santa Caterina, 4, 56127 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Picturesque park featuring historic estates & buildings, forested walking trails & a beach area.
detail_description: Parco Regionale Migliarino, San Rossore, Massaciuccoli is a stunning park in Pisa, Italy that boasts historic estates and buildings, forested walking trails, and a beach area. Within the park lies Ippoasi, an animal sanctuary where various animals such as cows, donkeys, horses, pigs, goats, chickens, ducks, rabbits and wild boars roam freely in almost four hectares of land.
name: Parco Regionale Migliarino, San Rossore, Massaciuccoli
address: Provincia di Pisa, Italy

excerpt: Outdoor leisure center based around 2 large swimming pools, with tube slides & a casual bar/cafe.
detail_description: Sunlight Park is an outdoor leisure center featuring two large swimming pools, complete with tube slides and a laid-back bar/cafe. For families who enjoy cycling, Ciclilandia offers safe and secure routes through the forest, providing a great opportunity to teach children about road safety while enjoying the natural surroundings. While it can get crowded at times, the park provides designated areas for relaxation and bag storage.
name: Sunlight Park
address: Viale del Tirreno, 44/b, 56100 Tirrenia PI, Italy

name: Marina di Vecchiano Pisa
address: 56019 Vecchiano PI, Italy

detail_description: Torre Ghibellina is a fascinating historical structure situated on the northern bank of the Pisan Lungarno, offering an excellent panoramic view of the river. It was once part of the city's defensive fortifications and served as a military garrison during the 15th century. Despite being heavily damaged in World War II, it was restored in 1956.
name: Torre Ghibellina
address: 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

name: Spiaggia Il Paguro
address: Viale del Tirreno, 68, 56128 Calambrone PI, Italy

name: Lupa Capitolina
address: Via Cardinale Pietro Maffi, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Church with frescoes & an arcaded facade, built in the 10th & 11th centuries over a Roman temple.
detail_description: Chiesa di San Michele in Borgo is a historic church in Pisa, dating back to the 10th and 11th centuries. It was constructed over a Roman temple and boasts an impressive arcaded facade. The church has undergone changes in ownership, from the Benedictines to the Camadolese. Its exterior showcases three Gothic loggias and three portals with lunettes, adding to its architectural charm.
name: Chiesa di San Michele in Borgo
address: Borgo Stretto, 10, 56127 Pisa PI, Italy

detail_description: La Siesta is conveniently located near a bus stop in Livorno, close to a large church and a new apartment development. It's also situated near the public beach La Tintarelleria. The atmosphere at La Siesta is cozy and relaxed, with clean surroundings. Visitors can enjoy very good food at the restaurant on-site.
name: La Siesta
address: Viale del Tirreno, 74, 56018 Calambrone PI, Italy
